definitions.definition: A ball that passes so far from the batsman that the umpire deems it unplayable; the arm signal used by an umpire to signal a wide; the extra run added to the batting side's score
Having a large physical extent from side to side.
definitions.example: We walked down a wide corridor.
The inquiry had a wide remit.

definitions.definition: Operating at the side of the playing area.
definitions.example: That team needs a decent wide player.

definitions.definition: On one side or the other of the mark; too far sideways from the mark, the wicket, the batsman, etc.
definitions.example: Too bad! That was a great passing-shot, but it's wide.

definitions.definition: Made, as a vowel, with a less tense, and more open and relaxed, condition of the organs in the mouth.
(now rare) Vast, great in extent, extensive.
Located some distance away; distant, far.
Far from truth, propriety, necessity, etc.
Of or supporting a greater range of text characters than can fit into the traditional 8-bit representation.
definitions.example: a wide character; a wide stream
A few shots were fired but they all went wide.

definitions.definition: So as to leave or have a great space between the sides; so as to form a large opening.
